decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful artifacts that disrupt the opponent's game plan while also presenting a fast clock with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void, Phyrexian Revoker, and Sphere of Resistance, this deck aims to slow down the opponent's plays while efficiently deploying threats like Walking Ballista and Arcbound Ravager to quickly close out the game. The deck also has efficient mana acceleration through cards like Mana Crypt, Mishra's Workshop, and the Moxen to power out its threats ahead of schedule.

This deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo quickly with cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Elvish Reclaimer. It also uses mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Moxen to power out the combo pieces. Pithing Needle is used to disrupt opponent's plans and protect the combo. The deck runs only a few lands to maximize the chances of drawing into combo pieces, with Thespian's Stage serving as a second copy of Dark Depths. The goal is to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token as quickly as possible to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this Vintage 1 vs 1 combo deck is to use the card "Doomsday" to assemble a specific and powerful combination of cards that leads to victory. The deck includes various cards that can manipulate the top of the library, such as "Street Wraith," "Ponder," and "Preordain," as well as cards that can draw additional cards, such as "Ancestral Recall" and "Gush." The deck also contains powerful counterspells like "Force of Will" and "Flusterstorm" to protect the combo. Other cards like "Necropotence" and "Demonic Tutor" provide additional utility and consistency.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with Dredge cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, while also using cards like Serum Powder and Bazaar of Baghdad to dig for combo pieces. Once your graveyard is full, cards like Bridge from Below and Prized Amalgam can be used to swarm the battlefield with powerful creatures like Hollow One and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will to control the game and protect your combo.

This deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly and aggressively put creatures onto the battlefield. By using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Stitcher's Supplier to fill the graveyard, the deck can easily bring back powerful creatures like Hogaak and Vengevine to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, cards like Hollow One and Bloodghast provide additional threats to keep the pressure on. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Collector Ouphe and Force of Vigor to hinder the opponent's game plan. Overall, the key concept is to swarm the battlefield with fast, efficient creatures while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures and disrupting opponents with cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Chalice of the Void. It aims to put pressure on opponents early with cards like Eldrazi Mimic and Reality Smasher, while also using disruptive artifacts like Grafdigger's Cage and Trinisphere to slow down opponents. The mana base is designed to support the Eldrazi creatures with lands like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple. Overall, the deck looks to overwhelm opponents quickly with powerful Eldrazi threats and disruptive elements.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast powerful spells from the graveyard, generating card advantage and overwhelming the opponent with a powerful combo. By combining efficient cantrips, countermagic, and key combo pieces like Brain Freeze and Wrenn and Six, the deck aims to quickly assemble a winning sequence of spells while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Key cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Demonic Tutor provide powerful card selection and tutoring, while Narset, Parter of Veils and Pyroblast offer additional disruption and control elements.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with dredge cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, and then use cards like Vengevine and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures. The deck also utilizes cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Cabal Therapy to further enable the graveyard strategy and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to quickly assemble a powerful board state and win the game before the opponent can effectively respond.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of disruptive creatures and powerful spells to control the game while applying pressure on the opponent. By leveraging cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to limit the opponent's resources and drawing capabilities, combined with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Deathrite Shaman, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up its own board presence. With a mix of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Assassin's Trophy, this deck is designed to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through calculated aggression.

The main concept of this Vintage aggro MUD deck is to lock down the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan while deploying large threats quickly. By using artifact mana acceleration and disruptive permanents like Chalice of the Void, Sphere of Resistance, and Thorn of Amethyst, the deck aims to slow the opponent down while deploying powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Karn, the Great Creator. Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland provide land destruction, while cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Sorcerous Spyglass can shut down key opposing strategies. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and win through overwhelming board presence and resource denial.

The main concept of the deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up for the win condition of Oath of Druids. The deck includes various counter spells and removal cards to protect its key cards such as Oko, Thief of Crowns and Griselbrand. By using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells to maintain consistency and find key pieces when needed.

This deck focuses on using efficient spells and cheap creatures to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal. It aims to control the game through card advantage and tempo plays, utilizing cards like Dreadhorde Arcanist, Dack Fayden, and Pyroblast to overwhelm opponents. The deck also has access to powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. Its versatility allows it to adapt to different matchups and make strategic decisions based on the board state and opponent's actions.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful instant and sorcery spells, along with efficient creatures and Planeswalkers, to apply constant pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategy. The diverse range of counterspells and removal spells provide protection and disruption against various threats, while the mana acceleration from the Moxen and land base allows for quick, explosive plays. The inclusion of Lutri as a Companian adds versatility and redundancy to the deck's spells, making it a flexible and resilient Aggro deck that can adapt to different matchups and situations.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan while gaining incremental value. It aims to establish board presence quickly with efficient creatures like Champion of the Parish, Thalia, and Mayor of Avabruck, while also hindering the opponent's strategy with disruptive spells like Containment Priest and Sanctum Prelate. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with Noble Hierarch and mana denial with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the game.

The deck focuses on assembling a fast and powerful combo using Paradoxical Outcome to draw a large number of cards and generate a significant amount of mana. Key cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Bolas's Citadel are used to enable the combo and win the game quickly. The deck also includes various control elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. The combination of powerful spells, mana acceleration, and card draw makes this deck a formidable force in Vintage 1 vs 1 format.
